text: shadow puppetry is a Chinese form of
entertainment over two millennia old
sway young king and his wife Wang Shu
Chien have been students of shadow
puppetry their entire lives their
affection for one another formed around
this ancient performance art which they
started studying over 50 years ago you
quit made fool you had to be able to
carve paint and construct the puppets
sing the accompanying music and perform
with the puppets it required us to
specialize in one thing but do many
things yeah I studied seven years under
five teachers they taught performance
manipulation singing and script reading
over the years they've accumulated
China's largest collection of shadow
puppets with over a hundred and thirty
thousand puppets some of which date over
500 years to the Ming Dynasty their
private Museum which is run out of an
apartment on the outskirts of Beijing is
a cultural treasure showcasing what some
considered to be the world's first
cartoons it hasn't been easy for the
couple during the purges of the Cultural
Revolution shadow puppetry performances
ceased shadow puppets were among a list
of banned traditional materials
considered reactionary and along with
much of the country's other priceless
historical relics they were destroyed
mr. sway and ms wang managed to protect
the puppets from the authorities during
that era by hiding their puppets under
the bricks in their home during the
Cultural Revolution everything was shut
down although the puppet troupe teachers
were sent to the countryside to do labor
afterwards there was a policy saying
they could come back yeah but for didn't
return they died I was embarrassed to
study oh the fool books were burnt at
the time no matter whether they were
good or not it would be reported if I
read books all I had in the stories was
mau mau
install body it was tough during the
Cultural Revolution we were both sent to
the factories to work he shoveled in a
metal smelting plant and I watched water
pumps my daughter wore gone for eight
hours i shoveled 20 tons or 20 tons of
coal into the furnace all the money we
didn't use for food we saved to buy
puppets the most glorious time for our
troupe was the 80s it was the first time
we travelled abroad in 1983 france italy
austria and germany in today's digital
age mr. sway and miss wong's business
has fallen off their love for shadow
puppets isn't supported by the Chinese
government the two have received zero
support for their shadow puppet museum
they lost their Beijing apartment and
mr. sway had a stroke due to his
condition he can only perform with one
hand today still once in a while when
they're able the two will give her
performance together just for fun we
weren't like today's young people who
find so many different deep ways to love
each other at that time work was the
main activity and we were together every
day we live together and work on fire uh
I forgot about wooing or saying sweet
things I forgot about love I didn't
think about how to love I was a little
stupid about love the socks side
you
